definitions.title: n.m.
definitions.body: :Ge 49:26 one consecrated, devoted (´[[נזיר י]] Sir 46:13 c (of Samuel); cf. Syr. nziyr RS:Sem. i. 463,2d ed. 483);—´[[נ]] abs. Nu 6:2 + 5 t.; cstr. [[נְזִיר]] Ge 49:26 + 4 t.; sf. [[נְזִירֶָח]] Le 25:5; pl. [[נְזִרִים]] Am 2:11, Am 2:12; sf. [[נְוִדֶיהָ]] Le 25:11, [[נְזִירֶיהָ]] La 4:7; —
of prince, ruler, as consecrated: [[נְזִיר אֶחָיו]] Gn Ge 49:26 (poem in J), one consecrated among his brethren, = De 33:16; cf. [[נְזִירֶיהָ]] La 4:7 her princes.
specif. of one dedicated to ´[[י]] by vow involving abstinence fr. intoxicants, fr. touching corpse, and fr. cutting hair (cf. [[נֵזֶר]]

), devotee (GFM), Nazirite: [[אֱלּהִים]] ´[[נ]] God's devotee, of Samson Ju Jdg 13:5, Jdg 13:7, Jdg 16:17 (exceptionally, from birth); usu. voluntary Am 2:11, Am 2:12, and for limited time, cf. ´[[נֶדֶר נ]] Nu 6:2 (of man or woman; cf. Peritz:JBL xvii (1898), 128), ´[[תּוֹרַת נ]] v:Nu 6:13, v:Nu 6:21, also v:Nu 6:18, v:Nu 6:19, v:Nu 6:20 (all P; cf. also [[נֵזֶר]]).—On Naz. v. GFM:Ju 13:5 Dr:Am 2:11, esp. Grill:JPTh. 1880, 645–680 Now:Arch. ii, § 97 Benz:Arch. 429 f. Gray:JThs. Jan. 1900, 201 ff.
= untrimmed vine (like Nazirite with unshorn hair) Le 25:5, Le 25:11 (HP).
